channel.title: 317 Coin pouch, how does it process input?
channel.description: So I'm trying to fix my coinpouch to fix bug where if you put in over max amount (2147m) it glitches the server, I don't want how to fix it, cause I want to learn that on my own. I just can seem to find where it processes the input.

item.title: 317 Coin pouch, how does it process input?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

NVM FIXED

item.title: 317 Coin pouch, how does it process input?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Read the post dude… The withdrawal is handled through a command. From there, you can handle it however you like.

Look in the client if you want to see how it sends the command/input

Read full topic
item.source: 317 Coin pouch, how does it process input?

item.title: 317 Coin pouch, how does it process input?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:2, topic:481057”]It uses a server command. “::withdraw”

Add a try/catch within the command to stop it from disconnecting the player and a few if statements and you will be good to go.[/quote]
I wanted a more specific method on how it process because, you can do right click withdraw and it have the same end-result.

Read full topic
item.source: 317 Coin pouch, how does it process input?

item.title: 317 Coin pouch, how does it process input?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

It uses a server command. “::withdraw”

Add a try/catch within the command to stop it from disconnecting the player and a few if statements and you will be good to go.

Read full topic
